Sensei,
   Happy New Year to you also!
 You have been most helpful and I just want to thank
 you. I really enjoyed seeing your picture on the
 profile page! Wow!
 I have a link of a picture of some kanji  and
 would like to know if this is the correct spelling for
 Koumitsushi. I would be grateful for your help.
 Thank You, L. Berry
If you want to write me off the list, my addres is:
wahmeister@...
  Kanji link:
http://home.i-plus.net/thorpe/kanji.jpg








--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Shinsei <sinseism@y...>" 
<sinseism@y...> wrote:
> Hello.
> I heard Goro Nyudo Masamune(Koumitsushi) had rarely carved his name 
> in his swords.But in some of his,the name "Koumitsushi" were used.
> 
> No wonder"Kiyo" in Fujiwara Kiyomitsu may sound "Kou" to non-
> Japanese ,but its Kanji is different from "Kou"'s in"Koumitsushi".
> 
> Regards
> 
> 
> --- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "wahmeister 
<wahmeister@y...>" 
> <wahmeister@y...> wrote:
> >  Sinsei,
> >    Thank You for your help.
> > 
> > I have noticed that Koumitsu and Kiyomitsu appear to be the same 
> name. 
> > If I am correct, was the "Kou" used to set Masamune apart from the 
> > Many Kiyomitsu's that came later?  Thank You, LB
> > 
> >
